bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Notion of Appeal
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Fletcher Decker for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and Writ of Certiorari
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION to the Clerk of the above entitled court, and to the Honorable ROBERT C. SAUNDERS, United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington:

You and each of you will please take notice that Fletcher Decker, the petitioner herein, by and through his attorneys, Beeler & Sullivan, does here by appeal to the Circuit Court of Appeals of the United States for the Ninth Circuit, from the order or judgment made and entered herein on the 14th day of September, 1921, wherein and whereby, the District Court denied the petition for writ of habeas corpus, and writ of certiorari, praying for the discharge of petitioner and remanding said petitioner to the custody of the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, to await the extradition mandate of the Secretary of State.
DATED AT SEATTLE, WASHINGTON, this 7th day of October, 1921.
Attorneys for Petitioner and Appellant herein.
Admitted notice and receipt of copy of the within notice of appeal is hereby admitted this 7th day of October, 1921.
United States District Attorney for the Western District of Washington.
